com.aloqa.trax.client.positiontrack
Class RandomWaypointFactory

java.lang.Object
  com.aloqa.trax.client.positiontrack.RandomWaypointFactory
All Implemented Interfaces:
PositionProviderFactory
public class RandomWaypointFactory
extends java.lang.Object
implements PositionProviderFactory

This implementation of PositionProviderFactory is based on simulated position data. It can be used to test location-based applications while being without a real position source, e.g. in an emulator. The simulation is based on the commonly known Random Waypoint Mobility Model. As an underlying CoordinateReferenceSystem, WGS84 is used.

Constructor Summary
RandomWaypointFactory(double minLat, double maxLat, double minLng, double maxLng, int steps, int millisPerStep, int minSleepMillis, int maxSleepMillis)
          Creates a new RandomWaypointFactory with the given options: A rectangle is specified that defines the absolute movement bounds of the simulated target; by adjusting the parameters steps and millisPerStep the speed can be regulated; the sleep time after reaching a waypoint can also be controlled.

Constructor Detail

RandomWaypointFactory

public RandomWaypointFactory(double minLat,
                             double maxLat,
                             double minLng,
                             double maxLng,
                             int steps,
                             int millisPerStep,
                             int minSleepMillis,
                             int maxSleepMillis)
Creates a new RandomWaypointFactory with the given options: A rectangle is specified that defines the absolute movement bounds of the simulated target; by adjusting the parameters steps and millisPerStep the speed can be regulated; the sleep time after reaching a waypoint can also be controlled.

Parameters:
minLat - The minimum latitude of the bounding rectangle.
maxLat - The maximum latitude of the bounding rectangle.
minLng - The minimum longitude of the bounding rectangle.
maxLng - The maximum longitude of the bounding rectangle.
steps - The number of steps to travel from one waypoint to another. Note that this value is constant. Hence, the speed of the simulated target results from the distance between two waypoints.
millisPerStep - The number of milliseconds per step. Directly influences the speed.
minSleepMillis - The minimum number of milliseconds to sleep after reaching a waypoint.
maxSleepMillis - The maximum number of milliseconds to sleep after reaching a waypoint.
